result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danesha R Lewis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Danesha R Lewis in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Danesha R Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for DPA hearing. Defense advises the Court a DPA offer is no longer available to the defendant and requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Danesha R Lewis in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Danesha R Lewis appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel informed the Court this may be in Deferred Prosecution Agreement posture and requests a DPA hearing.
Case adjourned to Branch 15.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Danesha R Lewis in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and potential offer. State confims pending tad evaluation.  
Court ordered matter adjourned. Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse. 
This hearing will held Remotely streamed Live through dacast - Via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Danesha R Lewis in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Danesha R Lewis in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Danesha R Lewis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
